title.narrative: EARLY LEARNING

description.narrative: Governments and national stakeholders ensure the provision of improved, comprehensive and harmonized Early Child Development (ECD) and ECE policies and services to address developmental needs of young children and prepare them for school., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, have increased access to equitable and inclusive quality education opportunities leading to development, improved learning outcomes and skills for life and work.

related-activity.ref: 2850/A0/06/882 QUALITY EDUCATION AND SKILLS FOR LIFE AND WORK

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Governments and national stakeholders ensure the provision of improved, comprehensive and harmonized ECD and ECE policies andservices to address developmental needs of young children and prepare them for school.

description.narrative: UNICEF has continued to work with the MoE towards the universalization of initial education services (for children ages 0-3) ensuring informed decision making for coverage expansion and ensuring quality standards for all services (both current and new). For preschool education, work has continued to improve the quality of services through social emotional learning. The program now expands to the State of Mexico, which is a priority state in terms of ECE, especially pre-school education . Finally,UNICEF provided EiE in migrant shelters for children aged 0 ;to 5 years and their caregivers. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:26/01/2022
